tweets.text:
Today I've been out with @MyDoncaster officers working across the borough to prepare for potential flooding.

We've distributed over 40,000 sandbags, we still have flood alerts in place, the next 24 hours are key, with peak expected in the morning. Please be prepared & stay safe! https://t.co/Cvxfigyigr

‚ö†Ô∏è @gmpolice & @EnvAgencyNW have announced a Severe Flood Warning covering parts of Didsbury, Chorlton & Northenden as levels of the River Mersey rise. ‚ö†Ô∏è 

A Severe Flood Warning means we must act now & evacuations have started, focusing on those most vulnerable first.

1/7 https://t.co/x23iGk7ydC

We have been bolstering the repairs we are currently making to Temple Manor wash lands in the Lower Aire today, as they fill up due to snowmelt and rainfall. Stay #floodaware and check the flood warnings where you live https://t.co/3UGLsuUejh

urls.title: Flood information for River Mersey at West Didsbury and Northenden - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: Severe flood warnings issued for West Didsbury and Northenden meaning the @EnvAgencyNW thinks there‚Äôs a danger to life. https://t.co/uvTR5U5qto

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been in #Croston where we have been operating one of our flood storage basins.

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ohmPMGkd1L

Our Hydrometry officers are out in foul conditions today taking high level gaugings. 

Vital to ensure our gauging station data is accurate.

Here on the River Tanat this morning at our river flow measurement station at Llanyblodwel. https://t.co/yMKd0vMNXN

Sure I saw one of the @EnvAgencyYNE guys dangling something into the river Holme today off a bridge in Lockwood Huddersfield. River was in spate big time. What was he recording?? #nosey #StormChristoph https://t.co/v0gWt8I2cJ

Two SEVERE FLOOD WARNINGS have been issued by the @EnvAgency

‚Äî River Mersey at East Didsbury
‚Äî River Mersey at West Didsbury & Northenden

Evacuation plans are now underway with an imminent danger to life & property.

#StormChristoph https://t.co/jqE5uTwOzT

We have issued a severe #flood warning for #EastDidsbury #WestDidsbury and #Northenden which means a threat to life and significant disruption. 
We are working with the emergency services to keep communities to keep people safe. Updates ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/Ue0KEP0snL

Our #FieldTeam from @EnvAgencyYNE have today installed some temporary barrier along the #RiverDon in #Doncaster.

This barrier protects an access route to one of the #Covid19 vaccination centres.

It‚Äôs a precautionary measure in case the forecast worsens. https://t.co/IHErO1V8Y8

We have 14 #flood warnings in place across Greater Manchester and Cheshire this afternoon. This means flooding is expected and immediate action is required

Check your risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/r0eYwgfghj https://t.co/JDTUFhoa1j

We have received many requests for sandbags today. Priority is being given to the worst affected areas of the borough. 

Follow @EnvAgencyNW to keep up to date with the latest flood warnings and forecasts for your area: https://t.co/L0sbOoOadY

Our field team was in Old Denaby today putting up temporary barriers to ensure access to the Covid vaccination site is maintained in case of any impacts of flooding from the #RiverDon https://t.co/hLC6LMgL3I

We are experiencing issues with the forecast model data displayed on our https://t.co/u5YnaL7y4i page along the #RiverSevern in #Shropshire. The correct forecast levels for #WelshBridge in #Shrewsbury are 4.1m to 4.5m which is more in line with normal winter flooding levels.

Should the worse happen, we will have all the updates and info on the flooding on @TX1_Radio and @RB1Radio tomorrow. Stay safe and follow @MyDoncaster @RMBCPress @EnvAgencyYNE for the latest advice to residents.

We are expecting river levels on the River Ouse in York to peak on Friday morning at around 4.6-4.8m. We continue to monitor the situation. Please stay safe and don‚Äôt walk, drive or cycle through flood water #floodaware https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/ZAEZaCPKhb
@davidpatrick @EnvAgencySW @BeBuckfastleigh Good question- I will need to ask someone who knows more. Get back to you in due course.....

Flood warnings and alerts are in force across #Yorkshire today. Here‚Äôs the River #Wharfe at #Collingham near #Wetherby where an alert is in force, but also a warning for Collingham Beck. You can check your local river level here: https://t.co/Rk3f6g5XmU https://t.co/pXtmZuOnwX

UPDATE: 7.30pm: Wet & windy day @EnvAgencyYNE @Calderdale defences tested, river & canal been high. Amber warning remains in place, but stabilising & levels reducing. Warning ICE from 0100 as rains ease. Outstanding effort #teamcalderdale inc @slowtheflow_UK #StormChristoph üôè

urls.title: Charlotte Cross: Are we prepared for flooding in Covid times? | ITV News
urls.description: With the added challenge of a global pandemic, Environment Correspondent Charlotte Cross looks at how we're placed if we have another winter as wet as the last.

tweets.text:
It comes after I asked councils and the @EnvAgency at the end of last year how prepared we were if flooding struck again during the pandemic.

They all said yes.

Storm Christoph could be about to put that to the test.

https://t.co/aNkUCBF8gU

Our thoughts are with @EnvAgency staff and other Cat 1 & 2 responders, voluntary organisations and community #volunteers responding to the impact of #StormChristoph and the communities that lie in its path. A very difficult start to 2021 but we look towards brighter times.
